subject: Sleep
title: The Hyperarousal Model
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Hyperarousal Model usable.

hook.text: Insomniacs aren't failing to sleep. Their brains are succeeding at staying awake. That's the core problem.

buildup.text: Brain imaging shows insomnia patients have elevated metabolic activity even during sleep.

discovery.text: The hyperarousal model says insomnia is an overactive wake system, not a broken sleep system.

twist.text: This explains why insomniacs are often tired but wired. Exhausted yet unable to switch off.

climax.text: Treatment works best when it targets the arousal system, calming the wake drive rather than forcing sleep.

punchline.text: Insomnia is too much wake, not too little sleep.

quiz.question: What does the hyperarousal model say about insomnia?
